alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Rockingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 3:25PM EST until March 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Northwest winds will gust around 45 to 55 mph, especially over the ridges. * WHERE...Central Virginia Blue Ridge, and Augusta and Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 1 PM EST Saturday. Rain will change to snow between 2 and 5 AM early Saturday morning. The steadiest snow will be Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility may be reduced to below one- quarter mile at times. Brief near blizzard conditions are possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Rockingham
